website_summaries.verdict: The comprehensive skincare and wound coverage of this fast-acting spray formula may seem too good to be true, but it is absolutely worth having a bottle on hand just in case one of your furry friends suffers a cut, scrape, or hot spot for lightning-fast relief.
pros: Soothes and restores cuts, wounds, abrasions, scratches, hot spots, rashes, burns, abscesses, sores, and other skin problems
cons: This is a fairly expensive formula, but its effectiveness is well-worth your pet’s rapid recovery

customer_reviews.title: Works well on open wounds.
customer_reviews.text: I always read customer reviews however I rarely write them. This worked so well on my dogs open wound I was compelled to write a positive review. She scratched herself raw under her chin. I was just about to take her to the vet but found this on Amazon. I bought a soft neck cone and used this spray. In about two weeks she was healed. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mindatwork

customer_reviews.title: A must for animal skin care!
customer_reviews.text: This is MAGIC! This product stops irritation, hot spots. I travel with one bottle in my car, incase my dog gets a wound or reaction to something. He has very sensitive skin. This product has saved me 100's in Vet bills. Below I have before and after pictures, after 3 treatments over 24 hours! No Vet! Not Antibiotics! I did give one 25 mg of Benydrl.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rae

customer_reviews.title: This is the only topical antimicrobial I use now - EXCELLENT !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I must type this in all caps: THIS STUFF IS FREAKIN' AMAZING!!!! Please - just go to the Vetericyn website and check out the before-and-after trauma photos of various critters. I use it on my dogs, horses, cattle, and myself. Zero sting, even in eyes and mucous membranes. (How'd they manage that?) It's as close to magic as a topical wound-management spray can get. Superb for hot spots on dogs, rain rot on horses, sunburn, chemical burn, thermal burn, lacerations/avulsions/punctures anywhere on the body, conjunctivitis, herpesvirus, thrush/whiteline, acne, non-systemic fungal infections... I will never be without two or three bottles of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ranch life

customer_reviews.title: Not just for 4 legged friends
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended for all your boo-boos. My neighbor puts this on everything, so when she suggested using it on my sons stye...I did. I figured if she didn't go blind he should be ok. It was an outside lid stye BTW. He had been on antibiotics two types of steroids and umpteen hot compresses...9 mos later he still had a stye. 1 week of using this hydrogel and it faded away. We use it for everything...I know it says it's for animals, but the people version just doesn't do the trick like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: K Ward

customer_reviews.title: Healing spray
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a neighborhood cat who kept getting into fights. He is very friendly and didn't seem to mind the spray although he will fight ointment. He healed up nicely, and I was able to catch him and get him neutered several months ago. However, I noticed two days ago that he has gotten into another fight. When he comes back to be fed, I will try to get him healed again. Glad I have this. BTW I have used it on my cats, but one doesn't like being squirted. I have to spray on my hands, then "pet" him. He has long hair and is a bit of a primadonna about getting his hair wet. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Aset

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I have a special needs cat that has a permanent hole in his head that needs to remain moist and open so it can drain. I've tried so many other products which worked ok, but this is the absolute best. Keeps the site open, and clean. I attached some before and after pics
customer_reviews.author: clever1

customer_reviews.title: The perfect antibacterial application...
customer_reviews.text: ... This stuff is amazing.... Have a skin problem ?? Apply this stuff 2-3 times per day until problem has cleared up.... I have used it on skin infections that antibiotic ointment had no effect and this stuff eradicated the problem in about a week... I'm serious... read up on hypochlorous acid and the effects if has on pathogens... Kills all human related pathogens in less than one minute.... Does not say "safe for human use" but I figure the time and cost would increase the cost of the product 10 times easy... so safe for all animal use, we are animals, must include us.....
customer_reviews.author: DAVEWASHINGTON

customer_reviews.title: Works but bottle malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: The gel got permanently stuck inside the nozzle (after I only had it for 1 month) and it was impossible to spray. Also, the top cannot just twist off to get the gel out....ugh what a headache! I called the company as their number is right on the bottle and they said this has happened a lot with their gel product and they will send me a new bottle. It never came and I tried to call back twice and left message and no response. Will never order the gel again and an extremely disappointed in the company. The product DOES work however so I will probably get the regular liquid spray kind again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Squirt Function fails Before 1/3 of bottle is empty
customer_reviews.text: That's all...it's a great product but the juice inside clogs the squirter thing and renders that function useless...which is why I bought the product...REFUND or send me another squirter thingy !!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pump stops spraying.
customer_reviews.text: You use half the bottle and the pump dispenser stops spraying the liquid, expensive for a half bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Blount

customer_reviews.title: a super dirty pond
customer_reviews.text: We went to a new park with our dog and didn’t realize there was a pond...a super dirty pond. He got a bath a little while after, but we noticed a bald patch forming on his leg. He felt the need to lick it and it was super red and irritated. We’ve been using this for less than a week and the difference is amazing. He doesn’t feel the need to lick the spot anymore, the skin is much more healthy and pink looking, and the fur is coming back coming back already. This stuff is great! The photos show before we started using it and four days later.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Wound care for all mammals works very well
customer_reviews.text: This product has long been a standard in my family who all have pets and raised livestock. This product works on all mammals, and is safe to use. I recommend the spray as it is easier to get a good application on squirmy pets. Apply a few sprays, use as directed, and you'll be able to help your furry pals heal quickly and painlessly as possible. Grandpa's dog had a worry spot on his belly that he was seen for at the vet, who also recommend this product. After a few days of treatment, the redness and soreness is gone and his skin is repairing itself. Even if he ingests small amounts from grooming, the product is safe.
customer_reviews.author: CarryIsRad

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer no good.
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer did not work, seemed to be stopped up after a few sprays. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Barry in MO

customer_reviews.title: Helping feral cat heal.
customer_reviews.text: We support around 11 feral cats on the farm. (They seem to love showing up on the farm!) We have all but two "fixed." One has a persistent wound on his neck. It appears to be self-inflicted. I can hold him long enough to spray this into the wound. It appears to be healing up, albeit slowly. He licks it immediately and does not seem to hurt him. At first, I had to wear gloves, but now he might be recognizing it is helping. This is good, as I have tried to pick him up and put it into a cage. Is wary of traps. It does congeal into a gel which hopefully adds protection for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Meadow01

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Vetericyn Wound & Skin Care is a miracle worker! A feral cat caused a nasty wound on my pet cat. With antibiotic treatment he was healing slowly but once I added this spray on board his progress increased amazingly! Within 24 hours I could see a big difference in how the wound looked. It also helped with pain and the ability to keep the large open wound clean. It needed to remain open for drainage. This spray was like a liquid bandaid. I’ve been using it for about two weeks and will continue to until wound is completely well. I highly recommend this spray! It is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for my home
customer_reviews.text: I get why horse owners call this stuff "holy water". It works. My little dachshund is prone to fungal infections, be it ears or skin, and this stuff is a must-have in my arsenal of treatment options. I keep it in my human first aid kit, too; we live in the country-fried middle of nowhere with lots of things that bite and scratch and cause infection, and I always clean wounds with this after rinsing any dirt out with saline or water. It's a very effective anti-everything that doesn't burn or sting when applied, meaning my fur-baby tolerates it well when I apply it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: This gel is the best you'll find for cuts
customer_reviews.text: This gel is the best you'll find for cuts, scratches, skin irritation, hot spots & open wounds. The healing process is quick & amazing. I used this when one of my puppies had an abscess after it ruptured I use the vetericyn and when it healed you would never have known he even had one. it's even safe on humans I tried it on one of my kids cuts and it heal just as good as any over the counter pointment. I do prefer the gel over the liquid and Amazons cheaper than purchasing in a feed store or pet store, I've paid $35 for the same size bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Esparza

customer_reviews.title: Clever Packaging.
customer_reviews.text: My vet says this product probably does no harm but it does no good either (with a smile that said, “You actually bought that?”) and the ingredients are not connected to healing in any way vs. known topical / medically proven treatments for dog wounds. Not to mention near $20 for a mere 8oz. But the 2 Stars here are really for the clever packaging of what was once a clear blue bottle to a solid blue bottle so you never know how much is in there new or how much you’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Pal Sek

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: It worked pretty good to resolve itchy spots (butt and paws) on my shepherd after 3-4 applications and I used it to clean minor cuts. But the gel stopped spraying after only 6 months then the spray handle broke so I still have at least 3/4th bottle left. I don’t know if the gel just solidified or what but really annoying to have so much wasted and I only used it maybe every 2 months. I will look for a different solution or maybe try the liquid instead of gel.
customer_reviews.author: Ovid

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: ALWAYS have a bottle of this in the house, use on all kinds of animals, my ducks to dogs and cats. Really helps scraps, cuts, gashes.. anything that's not vet needed. Helps with healing and has saved us a few trips of going to the vet and not needing antibiotics.
customer_reviews.author: bob maguire

customer_reviews.title: My cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: The product listing says safe for post-surgical sites and pH balanced - should not sting. My cat seems to hate me more for using this than she did for attempting to put on triple antibiotic ointment on her stitches and several attempts at elizabethan collars. Using this was the only time post-surgery she hid from me under a chair where I can't reach her. I think it must sting. I can't speak to its healing power. The squirt bottle doesn't work at certain angles, which is inconvenient for some wound care. I won't use this again. Some people said their bottles were nearly expired upon purchase. Mine expires in two years.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Finder

customer_reviews.title: This was my second bottle
customer_reviews.text: This on cost about the same as my first order but was much smaller bottle. It works well on cuts and sore spots on my boxer, it was recommended on the AKC site. It dries to a liquid bandaid like protection. This bottle's sprayer did not work, I poured it into the larger first bottle which still pumped ok. Not sure what the rating "features" are all about, don't seem to apply to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fast Healing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep around the house just in case, and when my dog got spayed I decided to spray some on her incision. Using vetericyn on her incision 2-3 times a day, her wound was completely closed by seven days after her surgery. It normally takes at least two weeks for a spay incision to heal that much. I'm extremely pleased with the effectiveness of this product, it definitely helped.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this very brand and like this last year and you can smell the hypochlorous acid in the gel which was really effective in my dogs hot spot and irritations, I bought 2 bottles in separate occasions and you cannot smell the hypochlorous acid and the hot spot and irritation didnt heal. I think this medicines quality has been downgraded to poor quality. If I can rate this to NO STAR! I will ... 😔😔😔
customer_reviews.author: arthur m estoque

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. Doesn’t burn. They don’t lick it off after it congeals.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is wonderful. It forms a nice seal on the wound like its own rubbery-like bandage. It lasts about 24 hours. One of my cats had a cyst rupture. The vet had tried to biopsy it & couldn’t get any fluid from it. 🤨 Yeah. I know. I decided her microchip had moved. Anyway, one day, this hole appeared. I cleaned it & doctored with this stuff. The wound has healed. Cyst gone. Cat is fine. She is fourteen after all. Switching vets, BTW.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about the Vetericyn Plus wound and skin care and the Vetericyn antimicrobial hydrogel (this product). I have Boxers who notoriously have various bumps, lumps and skin issues. These 2 products used together have been a godsend. First, I clean the wounds with the wound spray and then I use the antimicrobial hydrogel. The hydrogel keeps the wound moist and it really does heal A LOT faster. As long as I’ve been using these products, my kiddos have never had a wound or abrasion that became infected. I probably sound like an infomercial, but if you have a fur-kid you NEED this!
customer_reviews.author: Melayia

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I ended up using this to help clear up a terrible case of chin acne my cat got. She was not particularly helpful when it came time to apply, this does go on very wet. The scent is very minimal which I preferred. it did seem to help and now she's back to being her gorgeous self. I will probably have this bottle for several years due to how little of it was needed in comparison with the size of the container
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product flaws.
customer_reviews.text: The liquid has gotten very thick and will not spray. Only had short time. Would not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my dog had a sonogram and they shaved his belly. The save was too close and he became uncomfortable and itchy. As soon as I sprayed this on him his attitude changed and he began walking around like normal. A day or two later he was back to limping and being listless. I noticed that he had a cut, probably from being shaved. that had become red and inflamed. I sprayed him again--this time a few times a day for about four days. The cut and the itching were both gone within five to six days.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P

customer_reviews.title: Good Product But Not as Hydrogel
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I ordered the Hydrogel version of this product. The product was initially great, as usual however I ordered it in July and treated my dog's hotspots and it is now December and I attempted to use it again and the gel has gotten so thick that I can not use the sprayer and the cap is not a screw off cap that can easily be removed. It has been stored in the house at room temperature, so no temperature extremes to affect the product. I love Vetericyn, but will not buy this Hydrogel version again. I paid full price for the use of half of the bottle and the return policy is 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: DAWN RUNYON

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Keep a bottle close by
customer_reviews.text: I can’t rave about this wound care enough! We had a fun summer which involved one dog getting hit by a car and needing staples for wounds & a lot of road rash and then our other dog getting its ear torn at the base.... This Vetericyn wound gel was a lifesaver! Helped us keep the wounds clean and heal at much faster rate than anything I’ve ever seen before! I even used it on my arm when I got burned from the oven, healed so fast w/ minimal scaring. The gel stays in place when you spray which is so helpful. We will always make sure we keep a bottle around.
customer_reviews.author: MelanieR.

customer_reviews.title: Works really good.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very fussy dog when it comes to itching. His allergies tend to be different each year. When he starts to itch he will go to town. Until I can get him in to get his shot. He can itch till its red. My poor baby. So I found this product. When I would see him itch i would grab the bottle and he would run. Hes a sissy. He hates it at first bc the spray sound for some reason. Then once he realizes what I was doing he is happy. It does work really good. I'm happy with it and glad I decided to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, sprayer bottle doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my dog, she got a cut from the groomers razor, it looked like it was getting infected after a few days. I purchased this and applied as directed, it was easy to use, the wound started healing after just 1 day! I will definitely keep this on hand for any accidents or sores. I gave it 4 stars because the sprayer gets clogged after just a few sprays, its easier to use if you just open the bottle & put a little on your hand to spread. I might put this in squeeze bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Cate T

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your chicken med box!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe this spray gel made that much of a difference that quickly, but it did! My baby cockerel, Norbert, was severely hen pecked from the top of his head to his neck and back. I was treating with colloidal silver spray and it was slowly improving. I got the Vetericyn in and after 2 days (6 total applications 3x/ day) it looks significantly better. Night and day difference in the rate of healing. His wounds/ angry skin is moisturized and healthier looking.
customer_reviews.author: FarmMom

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this on my senior dog for a few weeks now. He developed a sore at the base of his back, right at the top of his tail, where he sits. This did nothing to improve the wound. It has the efficiency of very expensive water.
customer_reviews.author: ro22

customer_reviews.title: Does it Work? Yes, if you spray it.
customer_reviews.text: Our pooch had a semi-serious allergic reaction on his back. Had 2.5"-4" wounds. There are three Vetericyn spray products we used over a 7 day span. One helps with itch healing. After 7-10 days of treatment, the wound cleared up and is heeled. This product we continue to use on small abrasions. Would I buy again. Yes. Is it a good value? How important is your pooch? It does work is less expensive than a vet trip.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly, easy application very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome!!! My old English sheepdog suffers from flea bites. He gets flea oral treatment but still has problems if he gets bit. I was pleased how quickly it gave him relief! Discovered product from suggestion I read on one of the groups on Facebook. No worry about him ingesting any, very easy to apply and rub into irritated area. I’ve read how it offers relief from hot spots. Definitely a product you want to add in pet care!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W.

customer_reviews.title: Old product...gel to thick to spray. Manufacturer dosen't  care.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, however it just arrived a week ago and it has expiration date for June. That means it's only good for 2 months. I've ordered this product in the past and when it gets old the gel turns too mush. One month old. Gel too thick to spray. This is my second bottle and both have failed due to the gel congealing. I wrote to the manufacturer directly but they don't reply.....too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Magic in a bottle
customer_reviews.text: I keep this stuff around at all times. It’s like magic in a bottle when it comes to caring for your animals. Great for wounds, scrapes, rashes, nicks, allergies, etc. I have used this for horses, cats, and dogs. At the vet clinic we use and sell the veterinarian strength bottle but this has always worked just as well for me. I’m one vet tech that hates to rush my animals in for every little thing so having this on hand is very helpful
customer_reviews.author: Kacy Marie

customer_reviews.title: ... wife takes care of a feral colony and our favorite boy Vinny had a gigantic ulcer on his front ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife takes care of a feral colony and our favorite boy Vinny had a gigantic ulcer on his front paw. It was bleeding and he could barely walk. We sprayed this little bottle of miracle medicine on it for 6 days and lemme just say I'm completely amazed!!! He's walking fine and there is barely any sign of the injury. Our Vinny is back!!
customer_reviews.author: Carmine Deredita

customer_reviews.title: Clean Smell and is Effective
customer_reviews.text: Just great for my English Bulldog who has allergies and sometimes gets a fungal infection. She was constantly licking her paws which made her problem worse until I discovered this product. Used it twice a day and her itching must have subsided because licking was less and hair on her paws started growing back. This product is a very thick cream so now that her problem is under control I put some in a separate spray bottle with a little water and I spray her prior problem areas every day like others on here stated they do. Product has a nice clean smell, and my dog seems to enjoy me putting it on her as well.
customer_reviews.author: IEneighbor

customer_reviews.title: Great for Co-infections
customer_reviews.text: Definitely combats infection beautifully and works amazingly on co-infections like mites and candida. If there are mites involved, expect a "burned" smell. That's the mites' exoskeletons breaking down. It's unpleasant, but it's also how you know the product is working in this case. My dog does not like things sprayed... I recommend putting on a glove and smearing the product if such is the case with your animal. Works for humans, too, by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Nicci Eisenhauer

customer_reviews.title: Gel gets crusty
customer_reviews.text: The gel created a crust when it dried that had to be soaked off. Stick to the liquid spray Vetericyn which is outstanding and will save you mega bucks from vets. If your dog gets hot spots like my Golden, the liquid is a must, but stay away from this gel!
customer_reviews.author: Dulci Hill

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! Heals minor woulds a scrapes within days! It gels up after being sprayed onto a wound, helping it to stay there instead of running. It is difficult to spray at an angle but I'm sure that is because of the thickness of the product. I have 2 geldings and one is a pest, bites the other one frequently. Vetericyn is my go to for caring for anything from bug bites to other horse bites!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have a Boston Terrier who tends to get bacterial infections on her stomach about 2x a year. I avoid giving her antibiotics whenever possible so this topical gel is perfect for her! There is basically no scent and she doesn't mind having it put on. It's even safe to use on a dog's face near their eyes without worrying. Pretty magical stuff! Only complaint is that the spray nozzle seems to clog about halfway through despite keeping it clean with warm water after use. Still a great product!
customer_reviews.author: reallysusan

customer_reviews.title: Best hot spot treatment that  I know of
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for treating hot spots. Just to make sure that it didn't sting my dog's skin, I used it on an area of my own skin that I scratched till bloody. It feels neither cold, nor stingy. It also really does relieve the itch. I've found it invaluable for treating my dog's hot spots in the summer, seeing as it seems to prevent infection and the associated need to visit the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Eve B.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY DEOM HERE
customer_reviews.text: I had NO idea at the size. I was thinking an 8 oz as it's a bit higher than they sell for around here. It is a tiny little spray bottle that fits easily into a jeans pocket.. >17.00 for a tiny amount.
customer_reviews.author: TJTB

customer_reviews.title: Miracle in a bottle
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had a skin tag that kept coming off and making him bleed everywhere and it just would not heal.... I thought here we go guess I better make a vet appt as it was looking strange. I had been treating with a bottle I had but then noticed it had been expired for a few months so I ordered this.. within 48 hours his boo boo looked much better and within 5-6 days completely healed...
customer_reviews.author: MEL L.

customer_reviews.title: Good product to use to heal minor skin irritation, cuts or scrapes on your pet.
customer_reviews.text: Just spray on a cotton ball then apply to the affected area if near your pets face, as the spray will scare the living daylights out of it! Smell doesn’t bother pets, worked well in healing skin irritation on my cats mouth, as he rubs his face on anything plastic, flaring up his mild allergy. Good for the price and easy to use while not being lethal if ingested, though I’d avoid that whenever possible.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Really worked!
customer_reviews.text: My pug had a cut on his neck that would not heal. I was about to take him to the vet but I decided to give this a try and save myself a couple hundred dollars. I sprayed him daily with this and it actually healed the wound! What I like the most about this product is that it's thick so it stays on the skin and doesn't drip off. The directions say to spray it and cover it with a bandage but I found that it worked better without a bandage. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: MONKEYMOM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: This works great for minor scrapes and irritations. My vet recommended it to us, after our dogs got into a scuffle. Along with a surgical antiseptic wash it saved us a trip to the vet. Easy to apply, it’s thick and stays put. Just keep your patient calm and stationary until it dries.
customer_reviews.author: jbell

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Vetericyn is fantastic for healing pet wounds. This is the second bottle I have gotten where I have barely used it and the sprayer is clogged. The gel is too thick for the sprayer so I will find an alternate method to get the product out (did the same with the last bottle) as this stuff isn't cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Q

customer_reviews.title: I cannot rave enough about this product!
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Vetericyn Hydrogel on both my horses and my dog and I love the soothing and healing properties of this product! I cannot rave enough about it and how much faster it helps wounds to heal. I am so thankful there’s a product like this out there. I highly recommend this product to others!
customer_reviews.author: Can Chaser

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my poor chick
customer_reviews.text: I’m not going to post the gory pictures, but I had a chicken with a head wound so bad that I couldn’t believe it was living with it. I isolated it and kept it drenched in this stuff for a week. It is alive and well....and even resprouting feathers. Plus I could spray it down without being concerned about it getting in their eye. I’ve heard many tales of it not being a replacement for deep puncture wounds that should be seen by a vet, but for this application - I couldn’t have asked for more.
customer_reviews.author: CandleJules

customer_reviews.title: Really helps clear up hot spots fast!
customer_reviews.text: I began using this on my cat’s hot spots where she kept licking it raw and oozy. We tried prescription medicines and cortisones but it just wouldn’t fully clear up. I bought this after searching reviews for something to help her. After just a day or two the raw skin starting healing. It really does work. We use it on the little scratches or irritations on my dogs too. Love that it is safe even if they lick it. Really works!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: No muss nor fuss nor worries about safety...Ten stars!
customer_reviews.text: I second the rave reviews for this great product! I see results in one day on my dog's terrible epidermal collarettes ([ED] round lesions that scab over and explode in sebum-laden flakes all over her back) from her flea allergy. If you apply Vetricyn at the scab stage or any redness at all remains, I will see results in one day. No fuss (she loves the coolness), no mess, and no worries if she licks at it. Keeping it in you pet first aid supplies is a wise thing to do!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Seals

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on this based off the reviews; happy to report that it works! I have a cat that doesn’t like to be touched, (or sprayed for that matter) but I kept chasing him around and spraying this on his injured foot. I was trying to avoid the vet and the bills that come with it. Thankfully it healed up a sore in between his toes. This is definitely worth trying before heading to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Hayles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! My little dog has auto immune disease ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! My little dog has auto immune disease and suffers from everything, allergies on her feet are the worst! They get red/dark, swollen and so very painful she cannot walk. I came across this product last spring at Petco, I washed her feet everytime we went out to potty, came in dried them and sprayed this on. It began working, It doesn't alleviate her symptoms completely, but I would say improves them by 75%.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Traver

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders for contact dermatitis
customer_reviews.text: My cat has contact dermatitis from flea bites. First I put a topical on her to control the fleas. I have been spraying my cat with this product twice daily. I also dab the deeper wounds with witch hazel first. I could actually see a difference the first day I used this product. As the days go by her itching is less and less and her scabs are healing.
customer_reviews.author: nmcraven

customer_reviews.title: This is what the vet used to sell me for flea allergy skin issues
customer_reviews.text: Works great for small wounds, dry skin and other issues that are not critical but you would normally have to go to a vet to resolve. It should be in every pet owners medicine cabinet for the small issues before they become big issues!
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Oleb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised by how quickly this stuff worked. My dog had a massive hot spot and our usual treatment wasn't working. Not sure how I stumbled upon this but so thankful I did. My pup seemed relieved when we sprayed this product on his hot spot. Within a matter of 2 days his skin started normalizing. It's safe if they lick it, which surprisingly he didn't do. I would definitely recommend this to people.
customer_reviews.author: Sjix

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLY THE BEST! From a fur mom that treats my pups like my kid.
customer_reviews.text: Rarely give reviews but can honestly say that this product is the BEST! I was unsure if the reviews but after taking a chance literally 3 days the area of deep wound n cut my 2 yr old dog has is now healing so much better!!! So pleased. I put a shirt on him cause he was able to reach it n with shirt he can’t touch it (cone used was just uncomfortable) love my dog like it’s my kid. Now I feel better knowing he is healing so nicely 🙏🏻 Thank you for making this product!!! ❤️
customer_reviews.author: MHJ

customer_reviews.title: Must have item for your pup!
customer_reviews.text: I totally recommend this product as an emergency item on hand when having a pup because you never know what’s going to happen to them. Like they might get a scratch or hurt them self accidentally or start getting itchy patches. This product help soothe the injury while it heals by it self. I love this product! If you have a pup, you must have this in hand at all time.
customer_reviews.author: Amber H.

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: I spent $900 in vet bills on my cats paw pad to rule out infection and cancer, because it would not stop bleeding after she got in a fight. After 3 days of using this product, she looks better than she has in 6 weeks, and finally out of the cone of shame. I do have to spray it onto my hand and rub on her foot. It comes out really fast from the bottle and freaks her out .
customer_reviews.author: hks00

customer_reviews.title: Why does it smell like Bleach
customer_reviews.text: Dnt use this product I just contacted amazon about this product My Doberman of 12 weeks old had ears cropped on Monday still has stitches in and this product smells like bleach are u kidding me wats the point of using a safe pet product if you’ll goin to lie about wats in it I’m very displeased with the seller n Amazon for providing such horrible product this could have ended tragically for my Puppy note I threw the product out
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for animals & humans
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about Vetericyn. Used for years on animals & safe for humans to use. Cuts, scrapes, hot spots. My cats got into fight w/stray, both cats had gashes & hair missing on face. Sprayed with this for week or 2. Healing nice & hair growing back.
customer_reviews.author: TheM3rmaid

customer_reviews.title: Superior healing power and pain reliever!
customer_reviews.text: This is product healed my dog's sore, and seem to reduce her pain! She allows me to put the product on without hesitation! She even comes to me when I call her to put the medicine on! The negative is sprayer gets clogged after a short time of use. I'm able to apply the product using a cotton ball! Overall, I'm very satisfied with a product!
customer_reviews.author: fergy

customer_reviews.title: Great Find!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to put in the camping first aid kit for my dogs. What I ended up using it for first (with vet endorsement) was when one of my dogs had laser surgery on her paw. It goes on as a cooling gel and does not sting or cause other discomfort. It actually does seem to promote healing of the wound as advertised on the label.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesotan

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I have used Vertericyn since my dogs were puppies. Its nice to finally have a bigger bottle. The hydrogel is thicker so it stays on the wound and doesn't dry so quickly as it does with the liquid version but both very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Faith P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product don't change a thing my dog went after my bird when I was not around and it bit the middle of his little wing and removed his leg. No vet open got this product and it healed my darling bird and he lived and is doing awesome
customer_reviews.author: GLORIA skowronski

customer_reviews.title: WORKED AFTER ONE TRY! Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My little frenchie sometimes over licks her paws. She does it to relax before she sleeps. This was causing so excess yeast and the skin in between her toes and pads was red and irritated. I used a spray on each paw and massaged it between the toes and pads. It was amazing! All irritation and yeast totally gone!!! I could not believe how well it worked. I try to make sure she doesn’t lick it off but the fact that’s its safe if she does is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong kind
customer_reviews.text: There is another version of this stuff like for horse wounds (spray gell) that works fantastic on dogs. This is not that one, even though it's advertised as the same stuff. Vetericyn makes great products , just this is not "the one" I was looking for even though it's advertised as the same stuff. (the good stuff is usually available at feed and grain stores). May be OK for your use, but there is a better product out there made by the same company. I blame the seller for not better distinguishing between the two versions. This IS NOT the good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Christina K.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS ON HORSES, DOGS, BURROS AND CATS
customer_reviews.text: This gel does work on proud flesh on my horses and summer sores on my dogs. I have a rescue ranch and this seems to do the job on just about any deep cut or just plain sore. I like the gel as getting under a horse, anything that sticks when sprayed on is perfect. It is expensive but it does seem to go far. I will continue to use this on any injuries because it does the job in a shorter healing time.
customer_reviews.author: reen5horse

customer_reviews.title: Get the liquid, NOT the gel!
customer_reviews.text: I usually get the liquid, but I thought this would work better as it wouldn't dry as quickly on skin. But it has solidified and is unusable while still almost full. And the pump broke prior to that. It's a great product, but stick to the liquid. Avoid the gel.
customer_reviews.author: J Foster

customer_reviews.title: Part of my dogs' first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Helped heal my labrador's open wound on his paw. I use this on most wounds and keep this in their first aid kid (great since it's safe to use near the eyes too). If not used in a long time, the gel does get stuck in the sprayer and needs to be cleaned up with a sterile needle. My only issue with this is the sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Arya Nic

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is amazing, I have been using it for years on ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing, I have been using it for years on pets and my family. I use it after getting scratches from rose bushes when in the yard, my mom had a bad burn that healed really quickly and you can't see anymore. It heals hot spots really quickly on the dog. My moms neighbor (teenager) steals hers for break- puts. Works for everything. :)
customer_reviews.author: Konni

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Vetericyn for years and it’s great for even deep wounds. But this is the second time the spray gel doesn’t spray from the beginning. I have to remove the sprayer and spread on a cloth to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lolly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value for many uses.
customer_reviews.text: I got in between our males and ended up with a dog bite. This has healed my wound in 4 days. My small dog had surgery and I am using this on her wounds. Love that it is thicker and stays where you spray it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for hot spots and irritation
customer_reviews.text: I've tried countless hot spot remedies and the last few have required pricey trips to the vet, antibiotics and creams. This stuff clears the hot spots faster than any of those meds or creams at a fraction of the cost and has saved us multiple visits to the vet. Couldn't be happier to find this!
customer_reviews.author: Ginoya

customer_reviews.title: Great product--works well
customer_reviews.text: Great for our dog's hot spot. Like the fact that the Hydrogel stays put where you spray it, instead of running off onto the floor like the regular liquid does. Vetericyn makes really good products which are non-toxic and do not sting. We humans use it on ourselves so we know. The dog and cat put up with having it applied--in fact the dog sees the bottle and lies down so I can apply it, knowing that this will make her hot spot feel better. We scruff the cat and spray him and while he's not happy about being sprayed, he puts up with out without too much fuss because it doesn't sting.
customer_reviews.author: KKY

customer_reviews.title: Buy the one that is gel like, itll help it stay in place without running
customer_reviews.text: This is a miracle!!! I took my dog to the vet multiple times and nothing they gave me was working. She was sooo itchy that she was making herself bleed from all the scratching. She had red irritation spots all over. I saw a big difference in her skin the morning after i applied this to her skin!!! I am so amazed! I will def. repurchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo365

customer_reviews.title: Worked well . . .
customer_reviews.text: . . . on a raw spot one of our cats got from scratching at himself. Because it was near his eye, I applied it with a cotton ball instead of spraying it on. Applying it didn't seem to cause him any pain, and the wound started healing after a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: cd

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work that well at all and the bottle doesn't pump after a week
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't really work any better than a spray you can get at the drugstore or supermarket. And the bottle doesn't pump after a week of using. Unfortunately my lab's foot didn't get any better with this spray. A bummer--the reviews sounded like it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Concord

customer_reviews.title: My go to
customer_reviews.text: LOVE Vetricyn, I always have a bottle on hand for my animals and I (Yes, I totally use it on myself as well). I love how well it works, it always seems to help heal wounds beautifully and it's so compatible with a wide variety of animals which helps since I have a wide variety of animals, some of which are very sensitive to medications.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my GSD
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm for my German Shepherd’s occasional belly rash. I notice him starting to itch, spray it on the red bumpy skin, and it’s healed within a day or two. No more trips to the vet for antibiotics or steroids!!!!!!! I’ve already told friends and family about this product because I am so impressed. Kind of smells faintly like bleach??? But the smell does not linger and bleach is not a listed ingredient.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Miller

customer_reviews.title: Wound care spray
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for my cat who suffered a severe burn from the Seresto flea collar. Took over a year to mend back to health, but with cleaning and bandages, he survived. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Could be easier to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for treating wounds and infections, but it can be difficult to dispense, especially when the bottle is half used. It would be easier to use if it came in a squeeze bottle. In future, I will be buying the regular spray version.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: Healed up my rottie.
customer_reviews.text: My Rottweiler broke out in a horrible hotspot I presume from food allergies. Tried a few different remedies nothing was working but after using this he started healing immediately. Don’t forget to shave around the hotspot down to the bare skin. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Slick

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, don’t hesitate
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a MUST HAVE for pet owners. Years ago I was recommended this spray by a horse vet (to use on my little dog who had a deep cut) and it is literally a miracle worker. And safe for the pets if the lick it!! I’m a dog groomer and have used this product every since and highly recommend it to my clients. You will not regret buying this. So good. Thank you Vetericyn!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well on many animal skin issues if applied regularly according to the bottle instructions
customer_reviews.text: If used early on an animal's condition it works well. In my case, I obtained the Vetericyn a bit late and began application of it. It began to work slowly (but because I attacked the problem a bit late, it was necessary to get a second bottle of the product). The condition on the cat is finally nearing a complete healing. Although veterinary prescription products (such as Neo-Predef) may work more quickly than using a spray, Vetericyn is relatively cheap (a vet visit to obtain a prescription of Neo-Predef may run at least $70) so I highly recommend this spray. The buyer should obtain the product at the first sign that the animal experiences the abnormal skin condition.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Fans for life!
customer_reviews.text: Training our pup with a shock collar. She got some irritation. We bought this (I used the eye drops for our yorkie so i already trust the brand) and within a week hair was growing back and it was slightly pink and healing. Love this brand and their products because they work period.
customer_reviews.author: Dasia Stigger

customer_reviews.title: This thicker version is better than the spray
customer_reviews.text: This thicker version is better than the spray, but I don't know if it worked. I used it on my dog for about a week and her wounds seemed to get more irritated. I stopped using it in fear that it was causing more irritation than doing any good. Maybe it'll work on small wounds or skin irritations, but not larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and worked great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has worked with vets and now is a buyer for a "Country Store." She highly recommended it and she was right. Really helped our outdoor cat who had a flea reaction and later a fight injury.
customer_reviews.author: Ariele M. Huff

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Vetericyn Hydrogel is not overly sticky, so for those troublesome squirmy pets, you can put some on your hand and apply it manually. The product dries pretty quickly and I noticed healing after a few doses over the course of several days for during the recovery from my dog's elbow surgery. This particular wound is in a spot which is always getting stretched out, so I recognize that there's still some time to go before it completely is healed. It was recommended to me from a friend in rescue who swears by this and now so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Narucki

customer_reviews.title: CAN I GET A JOB SELLING THIS STUFF PLEASE?
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT LITERALLY SAVED MY DOGS LIFE. HE HAD A TERRIBLE STAPH INFECTION WITH A HUGE OPEN SORE. I HAD TRIED EVERYTHING INCLUDING ANTIBIOTICS FROM THE VET AND HIS INFECTION WAS NOT GETTING ANY BETTER. I WAS AT A FEED STORE AND THE CLERK RECOMMENDED THIS PRODUCT AND I COULD SEE A DIFFERENCE IN TWO DAYS AFTER USING FAITHFULLY. WITHIN TWO WEEKS THE SORE WAS ABOUT CLOSED UP AND I HAD USED NOTHING BUT THIS PRODUCT. I HAVE NEVER SEEN ANYTHING LIKE THIS AND NOW I KEEP A BOTTLE AROUND FOR ALL SCRAPES AND HOT SPOTS. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO ANYONE NO MATTER HOW SEVERE THE WOUND. I WOULD QUIT MY JOB TOMORROW TO SELL THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: KIMFLAUSA

customer_reviews.title: Great So Far!
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews, I was a bit skeptical but decided to give it a try. I've had jock itch for months, trying an endless list of different creams, sprays, and other remedies... The bottle says NOT to use on humans, but I did anyway... Ten days in, and thus far it has been the most significant change I've seen from any product I've tried. I've read a few reviews with concerns about a "bleach smell", I've found that if you do not shake the bottle well, (as advised on bottle instructions) there is occasionally an aroma that is similar to that of bleach. I've had no negative side-effects, and would buy again without any hesitations.
customer_reviews.author: Jase

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog encountered a bunch of fleas. We treated for that, but her skin was still raw from chewing and scratching. This stuff made all the difference. The raw spots disappeared in less than a week. Everything we’ve tried from this brand has been great. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CaerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It truly works!
customer_reviews.text: My poor Pomeranian ended up slicing open his skin through his coat after he was scratching with freshly cut nails. It was a clean slice that flapped his skin over, and this paired with the gel helped him heal in about two weeks. It was actually quite impressive. Our other concern was with his coat growing back, but it healed as if nothing happened. This stuff is a miracle and made me a true believer!
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: If you have a horse you should have this in your tack shed.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found any product better than this for healing equine wounds. Recently I had my16hh half-mustang-half draft horse attack my 3-year-old 13hh mustang gelding. It was a deep wound on a back leg above the joint. I used it exclusively after the vet cleaned everything out. It healed completely within 4-5 weeks without a scar. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron - I love this mouse.  This is my second purchase..after having dropped my first one seven times...the eight time was fatal.  I had no question in my mind about how I was going to replace it.  It arrived two days after I ordered it .  Very impressive.  I recommend this product to anyone.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My pup has hot spots and looked mangy. Been using it daily on him and his hair has grown back and he even wags his tail now.
customer_reviews.author: T.Worrell

product_meta.title: Vetericyn Wound & Skin Care Hydrogel
product_meta.description: Size:8-Ounce| Style:Pump[Made in the USA] Vetericyn Plus Antimicrobial Hydrogel is designed to adhere to the animal’s wound to provide soothing relief and protection during healing. All Vetericyn Plus products are made with hypochlorous technology, a non-toxic alternative to antibiotics and steroids for a safer way to relieve skin ailments and jumpstart the healing process. The unique hydrogel does not cause irritation to the skin and is safe for use in sensitive areas or with a dressing, like gauze, to keep the wound moist.
feature_bullets: ALL ANIMAL ANTIMICROBIAL HYDROGEL. (Packaging/Bottle Color May Vary) Help jump-start the healing process for wounds and rashes. The gel adheres to the wound site as a protective barrier after cleansing and treatment. Approved for use on all animals, from house pets to livestock.

PAIN-FREE SOLUTION. Apply the thick gel to affected areas after treatment 3-4 times per day. Excess residue will slowly evaporate. It’s specially formulated so it won’t burn or sting, and can be used on animals from young to old.

RECOMMENDED BY VETERINARIANS. Save yourself the expense of a trip to vet with solutions your animal care provider would recommend. From your home to the farm or ranch, care for your animals where they are happy and comfortable.

INNOVATIVE, RELIABLE ANIMAL HEALTHCARE PRODUCTS. Vetericyn is committed to developing the most safe, effective and innovative animal health and wellness products in the world. Each one is produced with scientific research and a standard of excellence.

STANDARDS YOU CAN TRUST. All products are manufactured under strict international guidelines and in an FDA-registered, state-of-the-art facility in the USA. Parent company Innovacyn, Inc. is family-owned and operated since 2009 in Rialto, CA.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
